original: Borgström, Allan Pontus, civilingenjör, direktör, Göteborg, f. 17/5/99 i Gbg av Olof B. o. Ida Wallin. G. 28 m. Signe Olson. — Ex. fr. CTH 20. Stud:- o. affärsres. t. Norge, Danm., Engl., Tyskl., Polen, HolL, Frankr. o. USA. Konstr. v. A-B Götaverken 23, chef f. konstr :avd. 28, övering. m. prokura 38, dir. i bol. 44. Suppl. i styr. f. A-B Götaverken o. Öresundsvarvet A-B, ordf. i Tekn. samf. i Gbg, avd. f. mek. tekn. o. skeppsbyggn :-konst 46, medl. av Inst. of naval architects i London, medl. av Lloyd’s Register Swedish Comm. RVO 44.
translated: Borgström, Allan Pontus, engineer, director, Gothenburg, b. May 17, 1899 in Gothenburg to Olof B. and Ida Wallin. Married in 1928 to Signe Olson. Graduated from Chalmers University of Technology in 1920. Studied and went on business trips to Norway, Denmark, England, Germany, Poland, Holland, France and the USA. Constructed at A-B Götaverken in 1923, became head of the design department in 1928, promoted to head engineer with power of attorney in 1938, and director of the company in 1944. Board member of A-B Götaverken and Öresundsvarvet A-B, chairman of the Technical Society in Gothenburg, department for mechanical engineering and shipbuilding in 1946, member of the Institute of Naval Architects in London, and member of Lloyd's Register Swedish Commission in 1944.
